title: Canada Economy Rebounds by More Than Expected — Update
description:
By Robb M. Stewart

OTTAWA--Canada's economy expanded more rapidly than expected in the third quarter, rolling back the prior quarter's contraction thanks to a reversal in the trade balance and a jump in government defense spending that helped counter softness elsewhere.

Gross domestic product grew...

title: Canada’s housing supply, affordability and economic growth can align in a positive feedback loop
description:
To move the dial and catalyze a positive cycle of homebuilding, affordability and economic growth, governments must create comprehensive programs that streamline approvals and collaborations between government, industry and the public.

title: Is Budget 2025 enough to reverse Canada’s economic decline? – Brandon Sun
description:
Opinion

The federal government’s latest budget describes the economic challenge we face in stark terms. It states: “The world is undergoing a series of fundamental shifts at a speed, scale, and scope not seen since the fall of the Berlin Wall.”

title: Canada inflation cools to 2.2%, core measures still elevated
description:

Inflation in Canada cooled less than expected last month, supporting the Bank of Canada’s decision to move to the sidelines after back-to-back rate cuts.

title: Canada Inflation Eases to 2.2% in October — 2nd Update
description:
By Robb M. Stewart

OTTAWA--Annual inflation in Canada cooled as expected in October as drivers paid less at the pump, but stickiness in core measures helps cement expectations that interest rates won't be cut again any time soon.

The consumer-price index rose 2.2% from a year earlier, Statistics C...

title: Canada's job market surprisingly expands, unemployment falls in October
description: Canada's job market made a solid gain in October, reversing past declines and beating expectations, and its unemployment rate fell, data showed on Friday.
